instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00850: What is 820-00850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  (95 laptops all same problem)  Powers on but no display
threads.message:
I have 100 of these laptops that showed up at my door.
They appear to power on and pull current and charge the battery.

No display.  
Power rails are present.
I was unable to get them into DFU.

Ideas?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  (95 laptops all same problem)  Powers on but no display
threads.message:
Did you test USB activity and external video?

Which voltages do you get on the board?
If machine turns on, all AWAKE and SLPS2R voltages should be present; so should enter to DFU.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  (95 laptops all same problem)  Powers on but no display
threads.message: we got them in DFU.   Force resetting them and rocking them out.
